Posts.Content: lisjo wrote: Hi all, One year ago after 17 years cancer free I had two lymph nodes and a small bone met on my pelvis. Did radiation and it took care of it. Then I was put on falsodex which did not work, then femera-did not work. I had a pet scan yesterday and found out today that I have multiple mets and some lymph nodes. I see my onc Tuesday, and he told me on the phone I will have to get chemo. I was ER+ but now I wonder if it has changed. He said something about a biopsy on a node that is by my esaphogus. I know that would be dangerous. It is not in my liver or lungs. My question-can this be managed or am I looking at the end of my life? What kind of chemos are out there? I had adrymiacin, taxol, cytocin years ago. It was horrible. Is there hope for quality of life? Lisa Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bad Pet Scan Results-please read and help me understand! lisjo donsuzbee

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2016 08:45PM lisjo wrote: So my oncologist took me off Falsodex as it was not working. He put me on femara. I took femara for seven years back when I was cancer-free. Is it a long shot? I had progression on falsodex. Two new small bone mets in my hips and 2 nodes-arm pit and by my trachea. only the nodes lit up on my scan. the assumed new bone mets did not. Since I was on falsodex since October and had progression ... Read More
Posts.Title: How do I accept my stage 4 prognosis? lisajo6 Iwillwinthisbattle

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2016 02:03PM lisjo wrote: Oh, I did. My oncologist took me off Falsodex, as it seems I have progession. My pet scan showed 2 nodes that have lit up, and my MRI showed two small spots on my pelvis that are"suspicious for developing mets". I had radiation in late summer/fall on a small met in my pelvis. My tumor markers are 111. They slowly, but steadily rise. I am so beaten down. I take this to mean I have quick progression....so now I am back on femara which kept me cancer free. I can't imagine it will work if falsodex does not. Still in bed at 2:02 in the afternoon. I feel doomed.
Posts.Title: How do I accept my stage 4 prognosis? lisajo6 Iwillwinthisbattle

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2016 06:40PM lisjo wrote: I saw my doctors today. The plan is not to biopsy anything and stay the course with falsodex. My oc said if my markers continue to rise he may switch to femera and ibrance. The ibrance scares me.
Posts.Title: How do I accept my stage 4 prognosis? lisajo6 Iwillwinthisbattle
